-| wceq(c1, cfv(c1st, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cnv), wceq(c1, cop(c2, c3)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c1st, c0))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cpv, c0))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(cns, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà NrmCVec ‚Üí c1 = < c2, c3 >)
‚ä£ c1 =(1st ` c0)
‚ä£ c2 =(+v ` c0)
‚ä£ c3 =(.sOLD ` c0)

comment: The vector space component of a normed complex vector space is an ordered pair of the underlying group and a scalar product. (Contributed by NM, 28-Nov-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
